intro: Monticalia venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan monticalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Venezuela. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface and a glossy appearance. Monticalia venezuelensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
